abstract: National Agricultural Statistics Service classifies large percentage of wheat grown in winter in region including Montana, Washington, Oregon and Idaho as below-average quality; wheat's quality was affected by drought in region.
lead_paragraph: Intense drought conditions have shrunk the kernels and disrupted the proteins of winter wheat crops in Montana, Washington, Oregon and Idaho.

headline.main: Drought Damages Wheat in Northwestern States
headline.print_headline: Drought Damages Wheat in Northwestern States

snippet: Intense drought conditions have shrunk the kernels and disrupted the proteins of winter wheat crops in Montana, Washington, Oregon and Idaho.
